thread.title: Road trip USA: 50 states, 50 scenic views
thread.title_full: Road trip USA: 50 states, 50 scenic views

title: Road trip USA: 50 states, 50 scenic views
text: Road trip USA: 50 states, 50 scenic views by Sarah Sekula, Special for USA TODAY | Published on July 13, 2015 Alabama - Caney Creek Falls in the Bankhead National Forest in north Alabama makes for a beautiful stop. Keith Bozeman Alaska - Mount McKinley, North America’s tallest mountain, is a sight to see. Abbie Bonney Arizona - One of Arizona's most-photographed backdrops is Red Rock Crossing in Sedona. Arizona Office of Tourism Arkansas - The country's first national river, the scenic Buffalo, flows roughly 150 miles through the Arkansas Ozarks. Arkansas Tourism California - The Bixby Creek Arch Bridge in Big Sur, Calif, showcases some of America's most beautiful land. Visit California/Blaise Colorado - While the Maroon Bells near Aspen are touted as the most photographed place in Colorado, pictures simply don’t do the peaks justice. Matt Inden, Colorado Tourism Office Connecticut - Located at the eastern point of New Haven Harbor, Lighthouse Point has extended a warm welcome to ships and sailors for almost a century. Connecticut Office of Tourism Delaware - There’s a majesty in the sounds of the sea, wind and shorebirds – and unmatched view – along “The Point” at Cape Henlopen State Park. VisitDelaware.com Florida - With 825 miles of sparkling beaches, Florida offers plenty of ways to snag some R&R, especially in the Tampa-St. Pete area Visit Florida Georgia - Take the scenic drive on Georgia’s Hwy 52 near the Cohutta Wilderness. It leads visitors to the beautifully secluded getaway of Fort Mountain State Park. Georgia Tourism Hawaii - Sunrise view from Kalahaku Lookout on top of Haleakala Crater. NPS Photo Idaho - The view from atop Schweitzer Mountain includes three mountain ranges. Schweitzer Mountain Resort Illinois - Beginning in Chicago, Route 66 in Illinois is filled with more must-see Americana than anywhere else, like the world’s largest Route 66 mural in Pontiac. EnjoyIllinois.com Indiana - The south shore of Lake Michigan in Indiana is ranked as one of the top five family beaches in the country. VisitIndiana.com Iowa - Mt. Hosmer in Lansing, Iowa, provides a panoramic view of the Mississippi River. Iowa Tourism Office Kansas - For a breathtaking and unexpected view, take in the sunset at Monument Rocks National Natural Landmark near Oakley, Kan. Kansas Department of Wildlife, Parks & Tourism Kentucky - Cumberland Falls, known as the Niagara of the South, is the only place in the western hemisphere where you can see a regularly occurring moonbow. kentuckytourism.com Louisiana - St. Charles Avenue in New Orleans is home to the oldest streetcar line in the world and offers scenic views of historic homes. NewOrleansOnline.com Maine - Sunrise over Maine's famed Portland Head Light, the state's oldest lighthouse, is definitely worth the early alarm. Maine Office of Tourism Maryland - The forever farmlands of Maryland's Eastern Shore make way for wine country. Experience Chesapeake Wine Country Massachusetts - The brilliant colors of the mile-long expanse of the Aquinnah Cliffs astonished early explorers. Massachusetts Office of Travel and Tourism Michigan - Surrounded by the ancient Porcupine Mountains in Michigan’s Upper Peninsula, the Lake of the Clouds is a blue gem set amid 58,000 acres of thick forests. Tamara Rivette Minnesota - While trekking along the North Shore Scenic Byway and “All-American Road” up to the Canadian border, veer off to Palisade Head for stunning views of the Lake Superior shoreline. Paul Stafford, Explore Minnesota Tourism Mississippi - Near the Beau Rivage Resort and Casino in Biloxi is an amazing place to watch the sunset over the Gulf of Mexico. Courtesy of Visit Mississippi Missouri - At 630 feet tall, the Gateway Arch in St. Louis provides one of the most amazing views in Missouri. The Gateway Arch Montana - Look for bison, elk, deer, pronghorn antelope, bighorn sheep and a variety of songbirds on an easy drive through the National Bison Range in northwestern Montana. Donnie Sexton Nebraska - The view of Toadstool Geological Park is otherworldly. Nebraska Tourism Nevada - Cathedral Gorge State Park draws sightseers with its unusual slot canyons. Chris Moran New Hampshire - The pond at the Saint-Gaudens National Historic Site was created by the construction of the dam for the mill. NPS Photo New Jersey - The sun sets over Barnegat Lighthouse, part of the New Jersey Coastal Heritage Trail. EduardMoldoveanuPhotography, Getty Images/iStockphoto New Mexico - Balloons prepare for liftoff in front of the Sandia Mountains. Albuquerque is home to the largest ballooning event on earth, the Balloon Fiesta. MarbleStreetStudio.com New York - New York City’s iconic skyline at night, as seen from Long Island City, Queens. Tom Perry / NYC & Company North Carolina - Wild horses roam free on the beaches in Corolla. Visit North Carolina North Dakota - A view from one of the many hiking trails in Theodore Roosevelt National Park near Medora. Theodore Roosevelt Nat. Park Ohio - A wildlife conservation facility, the Wilds, helps fund its efforts by providing safari experiences on 10,000 acres of Appalachian foothills. Don Iannone Fullscreen Oklahoma - On any given day you can drive down the main road of the Wichita Mountains Wildlife Refuge and see herds of bison on one side of the road and other wildlife species like the native longhorn cattle on the other. Gigi Ragland Oregon - When you travel to the Painted Hills, you can see millions of years of history revealed in the layers of mountains of earth, one color at a time. Chantal Anderson Pennsylvania - Hawk Mountain Sanctuary is a 2,600-acre natural area in southeastern Pennsylvania and the world’s first refuge for birds of prey. Greater Reading Visitors Bureau Rhode Island - Lewis Farm on Block Island is a place where you might see cows and sailboats but you won't see many other humans. Block Island Tourism Council South Carolina - Spend a day on Hunting Island and see for yourself why this secluded Sea Island is South Carolina’s most popular state park. DiscoverSouthCarolina.com South Dakota - Visit Badlands National Park and experience the striking beauty of buttes, canyons, pinnacles and spires. South Dakota Department of Tourism Tennessee - The topography in the Great Smoky Mountains makes for a great photo. Tennessee Tourism Texas - Big Bend is a hiker's paradise containing the largest expanse of roadless public lands in Texas and more than 150 miles of hiking trails. Texas Tourism Utah - The view of the top-heavy Thor’s Hammer formation within Bryce Canyon National Park, one of Utah’s Mighty Five National Parks. Utah Office of Tourism Vermont - With 76 percent of its land forested and the greatest concentration of red maples in the northeast, Vermont lays claim to having the World’s Best Foliage. Vermont Tourism Virginia - Breaks Interstate Park in Southwest Virginia encompasses 4,500 acres of greenwood lands and mountain scenery including the "Grand Canyon of the South.” Sarah Hauser, Virginia Tourism Corporation Washington - From the iconic Space Needle to the newly built Great Wheel, the Seattle skyline is one of the nation’s most recognizable. Visit Seattle West Virginia - Cathedral Falls is one of the most scenic and easy to access waterfalls in southern West Virginia. Wild, Wonderful West Virginia Wisconsin - Devil’s Lake State Park is Wisconsin's largest state park, offering magnificent views from 500-foot Quartzite bluffs. TravelWisconsin.com Wyoming - Devils Tower National Monument, which looms more than 1,200 feet above Wyoming’s eastern plains, is a one-of-a-kind natural wonder. Wyoming Office of Tourism Like this topic? You may also like these photo galleries: Replay
